vaccineData.name: BCG
vaccineData.description: Protects against tuberculosis, given at birth.
vaccineData.eligibility: Newborn babies, usually given within 2 weeks of birth.
vaccineData.precautions: Avoid if the baby has a severe illness or immune deficiency.
vaccineData.administration: Given as an intradermal injection in the upper arm by a nurse.

vaccineData.name: OPV (Polio)
vaccineData.description: Oral polio vaccine to prevent poliomyelitis.
vaccineData.eligibility: All infants and children under 5 years of age.
vaccineData.precautions: Avoid in children with severe immunodeficiency disorders.
vaccineData.administration: Given orally as drops by a nurse or health worker.

vaccineData.name: Hepatitis B
vaccineData.description: Prevents hepatitis B infection and liver disease.
vaccineData.eligibility: All newborns, infants and unvaccinated children.
vaccineData.precautions: Check for previous allergic reaction to Hep B vaccine or yeast.
vaccineData.administration: Intramuscular injection in the thigh or upper arm by a nurse.

vaccineData.name: IPV
vaccineData.description: Inactivated Polio Vaccine (injectable) to prevent polio.
vaccineData.precautions: Avoid during severe illness with fever.
vaccineData.administration: Given as an injection in the thigh or arm by a nurse.

vaccineData.name: DTaP / DTwP
vaccineData.eligibility: Infants and young children up to 7 years.
vaccineData.precautions: Postpone if the child has high fever or neurological illness.
vaccineData.administration: Intramuscular injection in the thigh or arm by a nurse.

vaccineData.name: Hib
vaccineData.eligibility: Infants from 6 weeks to 5 years of age.
vaccineData.precautions: Delay if the child has a moderate/severe illness with fever.
vaccineData.administration: Intramuscular injection in the thigh by a nurse.

vaccineData.name: Rotavirus
vaccineData.eligibility: Infants starting at 6 weeks of age.
vaccineData.precautions: Do not give if child has severe combined immunodeficiency.
vaccineData.administration: Given orally as drops by a nurse.

vaccineData.name: MMR
vaccineData.description: Protects against measles, mumps and rubella.
vaccineData.eligibility: All children from 9 months to 15 months.
vaccineData.precautions: Avoid during pregnancy or in immunocompromised children.
vaccineData.administration: Subcutaneous injection in the upper arm by a nurse.

vaccineData.name: Typhoid
vaccineData.eligibility: Children from 9 months and above in typhoid-prone areas.
vaccineData.precautions: Postpone if the child is currently sick with fever.
vaccineData.administration: Injection given in the upper arm by a nurse.

vaccineData.name: Hepatitis A
vaccineData.precautions: Delay if child has moderate or severe illness with fever.
vaccineData.administration: Injection given in the thigh or upper arm by a nurse.

vaccineData.name: Chickenpox
vaccineData.precautions: Avoid during pregnancy or severe immune deficiency.
vaccineData.administration: Subcutaneous injection in the upper arm by a nurse.

vaccineData.name: Td / TT / Tdap
vaccineData.description: Booster against tetanus, diphtheria and pertussis.
vaccineData.precautions: Delay if currently sick with high fever.
vaccineData.administration: Injection given in the upper arm by a nurse.
